problem.markdown: 1. Aim of this experiment ( ) None of these ( ) Measure pressure profile and average pressure (x) Measure temperature variation and average temperature ( ) Find velocity profile and average velocity. 2. Shape of the typical velocity profile of a circular duct: (x) Parabolic due to laminar flow and D shape due to turbulent flow ( ) Both shape due to laminar flow ( ) Parabolic shape due to turbulent flow and D shape due to laminar flow. ( ) Both shape due to turbulent flow 3. which statement is correct for continuous traversing and precise traversing method? ( ) Both are simple, rapid and accurate. (x) Continuous traversing is time consuming but highly accurate where as precise traversing is simple and rapid but not highly accurate. ( ) choice4Both are not simple and not accurate. ( ) Continuous traversing is simple and rapid but not highly accurate where as precise traversing is time consuming but highly accurate. 4. Question textThe locations of the measuring points are chosen in such a way that: (x) All have equal area ( ) Any point in the duct ( ) None of these ( ) All have equal gap along the radius of the circular duct 5. The apparatus needed for this experiment are: ( ) Pitot tube ( ) DP Cal ( ) Measuring tape or scale (x) All of these above

choicegroup.choice: None of these
Measure pressure profile and average pressure
Measure temperature variation and average temperature
Find velocity profile and average velocity.

problem.p: 2. Shape of the typical velocity profile of a circular duct:

choicegroup.choice: Parabolic due to laminar flow and D shape due to turbulent flow
Both shape due to laminar flow
Parabolic shape due to turbulent flow and D shape due to laminar flow.
Both shape due to turbulent flow

problem.p: 3. which statement is correct for continuous traversing and precise traversing method?

choicegroup.choice: Both are simple, rapid and accurate.
Continuous traversing is time consuming but highly accurate where as precise traversing is simple and rapid but not highly accurate.
choice4Both are not simple and not accurate.
Continuous traversing is simple and rapid but not highly accurate where as precise traversing is time consuming but highly accurate.

problem.p: 4. Question textThe locations of the measuring points are chosen in such a way that:

choicegroup.choice: All have equal area
Any point in the duct
None of these
All have equal gap along the radius of the circular duct

problem.p: 5. The apparatus needed for this experiment are:

choicegroup.choice: Pitot tube
DP Cal
Measuring tape or scale
All of these above
